Instruction: Turned oven to a temperature of 375 degrees Fahrenheit to fashion a myriad of flavorful dishes inside.
Combine and blend thoroughly flour, sugar, baking powder, ginger, cinnamon, cloves, and nutmeg in a separate bowl. Mix into egg mixture until a stiff dough forms.
Shape each half of the dough into a log and place them onto the prepared cookie sheet. Flatten the logs to about 1/2 inch thickness.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees F. In a mixing bowl, whisk together oil, sugar, eggs, and molasses. In a separate bowl, combine flours, baking powder, ginger, cinnamon, cloves, and nutmeg; then mix them into the egg mixture until a stiff dough forms. Divide the dough in half and shape each half into a log-shaped roll. Place the rolls on a cookie sheet and gently flatten the dough to about 1/2 inch thickness. Bake for 25 minutes, then cool before slicing.
Cut biscotti into half-inch thick diagonal slices and place on a cookie sheet. Bake for an additional 5 to 7 minutes on each side, or until toasted and crispy.
